intro: Crucihimalaya mollissima, commonly known as the Himalayan crucible, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many economically important crops such as cabbage and mustard. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit and small, white or pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are typically hairy and arranged in a rosette pattern, adapting to the harsh mountain environment. It is often found in rocky soils and is well-suited to cold, high-altitude climates.
